showScoreExcerpt:
"'Allegiance' needs to broaden our views of the world. In one epic scene, the bombing of Hiroshima is shown through the eyes of the Japanese Americans. It was a chilling moment for me. As much as I am always glad to see the Axis lose, it was the first time I saw the Japanese people in the story as anything more than villains... Not only is it poignant and timely, 'Allegiance' is entertaining. While the score and lyrics are rather ordinary, the showâ€™s actors make the play a feast for the eyes and ears."
